text: A rich, slow-cooked stew made from goat or beef, seasoned with chiles and spices. Served with consommé and fresh tortillas, birria is a signature dish that captures the soul of Jalisco.
This creamy dessert, similar to flan, is made with milk, eggs, vanilla, and cinnamon. Baked until golden on top, it’s a sweet treat born in Guadalajara and beloved across generations.
Thin slices of beef simmered in their own juices with beans, bacon, and green salsa. Served hot with radishes and tortillas, it’s a hearty dish that brings comfort and flavor in every spoonful.
